channel.title: What do you think?
channel.description:
[size=17pt]All the information here is from my own opinion and not facts. Secondly, This is not for a RSPS, it is just in theory. [/size] Hey guys, my name is David Pow, to give a little history on myself. I am currently in school and I can not work on my server as much as I want to. I program/work/do everything on ProjectBluelight. I do have to say, I am not a very good programer. Personally, I love video games, but to be honest i'm a noob at everything I play. One day I decided "hey screw you guys, I am going to make my own damn game." After about three months now I am here. Now to anyone who actually read my little history, I thank you.
Now To the point, I've been taking some time away from the computer and of course I still can't stop thinking of new idea's. I have looked far down into things. I have looked at every aspect that I can think of. I have been asking, and thinking to myself, "what do I want to see in a game?" I came to a conclusion "I want to be special, I want to mean something to the game, I want to make a difference, I want a Goal, I want Power" Now that is what an average person wants to be inside a RPG. What I personally think people want to see from MMO's; is that a person wants to be recognized by someone else, to have a friend, to interact, to socialize.
With taking and using each one of these personal aspects of RPG's and MMO's. I have started to come up with a game that is created to suck the player in. I have thought of a system that helps the player set goals and look forward to what they can accomplish. And yet at the same time lets them feel as if they by themselves hold a position of power among the game. I have also rounded it off, so that a player can also feel the pride between him and his 'team' (faction, what ever you want to call it) A Great way to get a player to stick to a game, Which JAGEX has done pretty well in, is the leveling system.(is used in almost every game) The leveling system is all based on experience points, widely known as exp... It has a way of just pulling the user in, and progressing him through the game. It is what a lot of big time games use such as - Dungeons and Dragons online, Runescape, Pokemon, etc... But i have configured and even better system similar to an Activity base-Free-Form Base. I have come up with a sturdy game method that I have never seen before. I have not yet completed it fully, so i will not 'give away' my idea just yet. In this I hope that I will get great feedback on this. Please tell me what You think of this subject and my theories on RPG's and MMO's.
Guys please do not forget that I come up with most my these ideas myself, So i really posted this to see what you guys think of my work in theory. I would love to be proved wrong or even given a better answer for it will only help me make a better idea for future gaming.
[size=18pt]Please contact me if u have any questions or you just want to hear more about it, or even discuss it with me.[/size] [size=24pt]Contacts -[/size] [size=14pt]SKYPE - Godofvictory, but my display name is GoV Chatango - Godofvictory Email - Projectbluelight@live.com[/size] [size=18pt] [EDIT][/size] I don't think you guys understood my post... I posted this in theory to state my own opinion on Level-based Games. I did say that I have an idea, but I have not revealed it yet. I am still working on it that is why. Also for the reasons of people stealing this idea. Back to the point though, [size=14pt]I MADE THIS POST SO THAT I COULD SEE YOUR GUY'S THOUGHTS ON LEVEL BASE GAMES, RPG's, MMO's, And MMORPG's. [/size]

item.title: What do you think?
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

Lin’s post just gave me an idea.

Try to make an RPG that requires constant attention whilst online.
(I’ve seen that before. I play one currently. Pretty addicting.)

It’s hard for me to get off the game at 2AM. It has no leveling, if you added that and your other ‘amazing ideas’, the game could be very successful.

item.title: What do you think?
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Taking 3 months off and coming here trying to build your way up isn’t going to help at all.

Here’s my opinion on your idea: No. RPGs can’t be unique and they’ll always be the boring sit-and-watch. The goals are always the same: do this so you can do this later then sit and watch some more. Honestly I don’t see anything in your ‘great idea’ that isn’t the base of every other RPG out there.
